intro: Ribes fasciculatum var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, yellow-orange berries. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features upright stems with alternate, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in early spring before the leaves. The berries are edible and have been used in traditional Asian cuisine and medicine.
